FuncDef:
The cos command displays a queue priority sub-view of a flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode.
The undo cos command restores the default configuration in a queue priority sub-view of a flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode.
By default, the default configurations of eight queue priority sub-views exist in a flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a CoS for a flow queue.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 7.
0: cos 01: cos 12: cos 23: cos 34: cos 45: cos 56: cos 67: cos 7

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can configure scheduling parameters (including a scheduling priority, weight, CIR, PIR, and drop policy) for eight priority flow queues in a flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode, providing differentiated QoS guarantee for service traffic with different priorities.
Prerequisites
Before configuring scheduling parameters for a user queue with a specified priority, you must run this command to enter the queue priority sub-view.
Precautions
Only LPUI-52/LPUF-53/LPUI-242/LPUF-243/LPUI-242-CM/LPUI-242-G/LPUI-402/LPUI-402-CM/LPUF-483/LPUI-2T-L/LPUI-2T-CM/LPUF-1T2 boards support a flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode.
